short_summary: Tires and Tubes Pneumatic Aircraft Buy
description: Due to maintenance requirements, this contract is for the purchasing of 20- tires of the part "DR6795" for the 7 CFSD Edmonton"\
full_summary:
======

### Aviation Replacement Parts
=====

#### Reference Number
---------------

* Reference Number: PW-23-01022720
* Solicitation Number: W8485-237401/A

#### Government of Canada Contracting Space
----------------------------------------

This Request for Proposal (RFP) is issued by the Department of National Defence (DND) to procure the following item:

* GSIN: N2620
* Description (English): Tires and Tubes, Pneumatic, Aircraft
* Description (French): Pneumatiques et chambres à air d'aéronefs

The delivery location is 7 Canadian Forces Support Establishment (CFSE) Depot in Edmonton, Alberta.

#### Tender Details
--------------

* Tender Closing Date: Thursday, February 10, 2023, 2:00 p.m. Mountain Standard Time (MST)
* GovernmentSA?: (None)
* Product Identifier Codes:
	+ GSIN: N2620
	+ North Atlantic Treaty Organization (NATO) Code:
	+ Numerical Item Identification Number (NIIN):
	+ CAGE code:
* Total Quantity: 20

#### Selection Criteria
-----------------------------

To be eligible to bid for this RFP, suppliers must demonstrate expertise in the replacement part requirements outlined in this RFP.

#### Evaluation Criteria
------------------------

The following factors will be used to evaluate bids:

* Technician expertise
* Company Health and Safety record
* Quality control measures

#### Preliminary Assessment of Bids
-------------------------------------

Bidders who are proceeding to the shortlisted phase of the evaluation process may be required to table alternative products, part numbers, or EEOP numbers that comply with the requirements outlined in this RFP. Shortlisted bidders will be required to submit complete commercial offers that outline the commercial, technical, and administrative terms of supply within 30 days of being notified of their shortlisting.

#### Compliance with Regulations
-----------------------------

All bidders must meet standard terms and conditions of the contract. Are you aware of your place in the sub-supply chain?

All documents may be submitted in either official language of Canada and must comply with the information described in the technical specifications in each Amendment.
